review: Great service at the bar every time I go! Clean, friendly environment. I'm glad they took the calories off the menu, I go out to enjoy my meal and don't wanna see that!
Yack... Seeing waitress fixing her ponytail then grabbing limes to squeeze in drinks...

We stopped here on a long road trip to get something quick but maybe a little better than fast food and were severely disappointed. First off, when we first walked in their was no hostess. We looked around, no waitress or bartender to be seen so we waited several minutes to be seated. This isn't that bad, but just unusual. The bathrooms were appalling, disgusting in smell and the floor was intensely slippery. There were 4 of us and the waitress completely messed up completely 2 of our orders, after we waited quite a while to get our food. So our quick stop put us at 1 hour 20 minutes. Refills were never offered on our drinks. The food was so greasy I barely ate half of what I ordered. I'm not a big Chilis fan to begin with but this location was a terrible experience for us.

Stopped by Saturday, April 22, 2017 for dinner @7pm.    39 minute wait that was only 10. Upbeat server, suggested the $5 margarita which was great.     Menu has many options, I enjoyed the combo platter with ribs, chicken & sausage - excellent choice.   My wife got the fajitas (beef&chicken) which was not very good      Meat was unusual flavor.   Several managers very active running food, helping were needed and keeping place running well.     If you have not tried child's lately give it chance.     We did.

There were three adults in our party. Service was friendly, professional, courteous, and very attentive. Tables are small considering the size of the plates. The portions are great prices are what you would expect.  Mid prices. Good food. Nice clean atmosphere. Music is just loud enough to be in the back ground.

Was just at this location this evening. Probably our 10th visit.  Each time we resolve to not go back.  Not because of the quality of food. It's good for the most part. What this location lacks is service.  Each waiter or waitress is worse than the last.  It is clear that there is no manager on duty, and the staff is lacking basic training. Solution? 1. Get the order right.  Confirm it when the order happens so there are no mistakes, no need for a re-do. 2. Check back with your customers every couple of minutes. If you can't, send the manager or the hostess. 3. If anyone asks for water, bring water for everyone. 4. If your customers have small children, bring their food first. Make it happen quickly.  Little kids get bored and restless. 5. If the place is super busy, call in your best people and make a fortune.   Chili's, get new management and staff for this location pronto.

We were regular patrons in the past but lately their service has been extremely slow and inexcusable.  The appetizer was cold by the time it easy served, and that took 20 minutes.  We had to ask for the salad that came with the 3/ $10meal. We had to ask for refills on drinks. The table across from us had an even longer wait, they finally asked for chips. They never came, but 5 minutes later their food arrived. We've been here 45 minutes and are still waiting for our food. This is not the first time we've experienced this situation. Survey says: I  won't be back.

Arrived at 10:30, well before the 11 PM closing time, but was treated as if I was inconveniencing them. I should have listened to the other reviews about the attitude. Maybe my food will be good, but I'll definitely need the dirty silverware replaced first. Ugh! Update: Fajita's were ok but they forgot my fries. I dare not ask for them for fear of the "kitchen closed" wrath. What happened to the Chili's I used to love????? :(

We had a great dinner tonight at Chili's.  We were seated promptly, served promptly and the food was excellent.  We had the best waitress ever!  They told us she's new, but anyway Shane, you added to the enjoyment of our dinner.

The whole Chili's chain has gone down hill ever since they removed the grills and replaced them with infrared conveyor belts. They call this the kitchen of the future. This is supposed to speed up the orders. They are trying to make their food like McDonald's so anyone without cooking skills can cook in their kitchen. The chicken and shrimp come out like they have been boiled and not grilled like the advertise in their menus. All of the pictures on the menus and TV commercials show grill marks as if the food is grilled. This is false advertising and Chili's should remove the word grill from their name and stop calling their food grilled. They call the chicken grilled in several dishes. Today we had chicken fajitas and this is the last time we will be eating anything at Chili's. The fajitas at Chili's used to be the best and now they are the worst. Next thing will be salsa from a can and chips from a bag. It's coming. Anything to cut costs and lower quality. Now with the tablets at the tables they want to eliminate the interaction with the servers.  After 20 loyal years going to Chili's having fajitas weekly, we are done.

Called To Go and ordered a burger and chicken fingers at 619. They told me come by in 20. So I came by at 640 and waited until 720 to finally get my raw burger and the worst chicken fingers I have ever seen. They didn't have any more breaded chicken, so they fried the chicken and it wasn't even halfway cooked. Now my girlfriend is missing class because she's suffering from food poisoning from one bite of this "meat". This is a terrible excuse for a restaurant and I would advise anyone and everyone to stay away from here for safetys sake.

I love the food at the Chili's chain. But the Westford location is so incredibly disappointing. I went in around 7pm on a weeknight. The place was 2/3 empty, but for some reason I had to wait about 5 minutes for a table. I thought the hostess was pulling my leg at first. I didn't see a lot of my waiter, even though, again, the place was about 2/3 empty. I ordered a burger, which took at least 20 minutes. I wasn't in any hurry, but it seemed odd. The table next to me was a family of 4, and they had ordered before I walked in. A bit after my food arrived, they complained that they still hadn't received their food. I heard the waiter explain that their pasta sometimes takes 13 minutes to prepare, even though they'd definitely been waiting twice that time. The burger was so-so. Not bad, but nothing to write home about. All around, this was a disappointing visit and I don't think I'll be back.

I don't really know why we keep coming here. The last time we waited 5 minutes for someone to wander to the host stand to be seated, another 10 minutes for the server to greet our table. We told her we were on a time crunch. We waited 25 minutes for our food. I thought Chilis was supposed to be quick especially because I ordered a quesadilla and my hubby got a med rare steak (which came out well done).

Worst sandwich I've ever been served.  I have ago to Chilis sandwich that I always get and at any other location have loved it.  At this location I could not eat it!  I had to ask if there was someone to wait on me and I was one of two customers on the bar.  Even if you are a chili's fan I'd pass up this location.  If I could give zero stars or better yet negative I would! I'm writing this from the parking lot because it was so bad...
This place was on par with what you expect from chili's.  Hit up Wednesday night for the ribs special!

Amy at the bar was great.  However, the food was horrible.  I ordered the new Ranchero Chicken Tacos.  They appeared to be thrown together.  No presentation to be seen.  The contents of the tacos were skimpy, and they were served cold.  IN addition, I would have imagined that the chicken would have been shredded after having been sauteed in some sauce.  NOPE.  The chicken was grilled, and apparently microwaved, so it was rock hard.  Not recommended for food

Horrible service. Waited 15 minutes for the server to even come over to us. There was another table that just up and left because they didn't want to wait. I see their staff slowly rolling in through the door, it's 12:08 on a Friday... why is half the staff coming in after the start of prime lunch time. Food is okay, I normally get the Flatbread pizza, normally service is a lot better but this is horrible.
Chili's has had a formula of reasonable place for a reasonable price for years and it works for them. As long as you know what you are to expect you are going to enjoy yourself.

Terrible. They now have tablets on each table that the kids just need to play with a fight over. Obviously, whoever came up with this bright idea has no kids. We had to have it taken away. But of course, not before one kid bought games, the tablet makes it so easy to buy "table entertainment" Goodbye Chilis.

Hands down the worst chili's experience ever, had a Cate or something as the waitress and she was just rude. She was never was in a good mood and was all was coughing on her sleeve constantly. The cough is what really got me because she's handling my food and I don't want to get sick. Either way the food was ok but it was the service was just horrible.

This Chili's is totally missable. I don't know what happened to Chili's - it used to be good. This one is definitely missable. Why? How about? --- - wait forever to make my order - waiter brings my drink, but forgets water and cultery - wait forever and never see the guy - brings the food and I have to remind him I have no cultery and no water - run out of my drink -- and would probably have had another but alas the waiter is no where to be found - the food is messy -- one napkin -- you get the picture -- and no waiter, etc to get another one or two! - the restaurant was not busy but staff was busy chatting each other up instead of making sure clients were satisfied - finally was able to get the bill - waited a long time for someone to pick up the credit card - finally got the manager's attention and he did it and asked me if everything was ok - uh NO!!! - Was totally ridiculous -- he was as bad as the rest - chatting up the hostess - I mean people - get it together - the food was ok -- the service was brutal - I won't be back and won't recommend to others  Get with it folks. Times are tough -- if you don't want the job - I am sure there is someone that would be happy to do a good job for the money!
We were mocked by the staff repeatedly, and the food was sub par. All in all, I would not recommend this restaurant to anybody

Tonight... They get 5 stars. We sat in Justin's section. Justin rocks every waiter/waitress should have Justin's personality! Our food was really good, drink good... But what made the night was Justin! Ohhh and Mike, he brought us our food! He was great too.. These guys both had a great sense of humor... And were helpful but real. My husband and I have had one too many BAD experiences at restaurants and were close to giving up.... These two gentleman renewed our hope..... And enjoyment of restaurant dining.... And meeting new people. I went with my best friend and husband tonight and we really needed a good meal and a few laughs.. And these guys delivered. Thanks Justin and Mike!!!!!

Horrible...my daughter and I stopped in after her gymnastics class for a quick dinner.  It was post dinner rush about 8 pm and we were seated right away.  Took 5 min for a waitress to appear, 10 minutes to get our drinks for which the bar was blamed....and 55 minutes to get kids Mac n cheese and a quesadilla.....really?  After all that the Mac n cheese came out first....with a "figured I'd get hers out".  My quesadilla came a few minutes later.  Didn't stop back to the table until halfway through and I informed her I never got the ranch sauce.  She brought me ranch dressing, not the sauce promised on the menu.  I asked for the check and was told to use the new tabletop cash out system.  I pulled up my check and it was incorrect only charging me for beverages.  She had to go in the back and "merge the checks"....another delay.  Way too long for mediocre.

Alright, if you're a teenager in the metrowest area with a driver's license and it's past 10 PM but before 12 AM (fri thru sat), this place is AWESOME. Basically Chili's is the most boring restaurant in the universe, but if you meet the conditions described above, you'll probably have a great time.

Food was ok nothing special. I'm not a huge fan of any of the chains in the area, but had a gift card. I think I had the worst waitress ever. She simply just disappeared, and basically just dodged our table, which only consisted of myself and 14 year old niece, ordering simple meals and waters. Basically had to jump out from our table to get her attention, just for our check. I felt like I aged a couple years waiting for some sort of service. Honestly we could have been served and brought our check, left a nice tip, and been on our way. I don't think I have ever left less than a 25% tip, up until tonight. Really  Chili's?

After attempting to take my mom to her first Bruins game, the game was cancelled, so we just decided to crash here since it was close to home. I was never a big Chili's fan so I didn't expect much. This place was just a little bit better than I expected. We got a pretzel stick appetizer and that we actually pretty good. I got the Crispy Chicken Crisper's and they were well cooked and well seasoned, but I have had better. My mom got a burger and found it to be standard Chili's quality. The fries were good as well. Dessert was tasty as well. On a normal Chili's visit, it probably would have been so average that I wouldn't post a review, but I decided to make a exception for this time. Good place to go when your craving a decent burger and beer, as well as other grilled or fried food.

Their food is good. Service is usually fast, and the waitresses are friendly. The decor is a bit outdated. Haven't tried their bar, so cannot comment on it.like the new tablets on each table that let you see the menu, reorder drinks, pay your check and there's apps for the kids : for a one time fee of 2.99. Overall, a good place for a family dinner.
Ok. Beer is always good and reasonable! The appetizers are good and sizzling chicken fajitas are good. Good place to go for a few drinks and quick bite to eat.

Haven't been here since my first writeup, since I vowed never to return, but I lied.  My sister and I had a really good leisurely lunch here yesterday. She ordered the chicken Caesar salad (was huge and she ended up taking home much of the chicken), and I had the sliced sirloin, with sautéed mushrooms, caramelized onions,  and arugula on warm flatbread. Both of our orders hit the spot. The waitress was very friendly and made sure to refill the water and iced tea. My sister and I spent a couple of hours here and no one pressed us to leave or handed us the check so we'd feel rushed. Too bad we weren't here a little later in the day so we could partake in a margarita or two, but we both still had errands to complete.

Came in on Saturday last,  worst service ever.  Waited 30+ minutes for a couple burgers and fajitas.  Asked for more guacamole, took 5 minutes +.  There are only 10 people in here.  Won't be back!  Manager hasn't come out of the kitchen once, just hovers by the door and disappears back into the kitchen again.

Worst.... Got a burger that was supposed to have onion rings on it.  Had a fried blob on it that turned our to be an old fried shrimp. Bartender tried to rip me off by including 20% tip on bill... asked if it was tip included....said no....   those are just the two biggest things....dirty silverware asked for bill asked for menu asked for silverware....etc.   won't be back

While waiting for a takeout order, you get a good view of the kitchen staging counter. This is the area where orders are passed from the kitchen to waitstaff and others who put the last touches on the plates and make sure the orders are complete before heading out. At one point, someone who appreared to be a manager or shift leader reached over the counter area. Did he get on his tip toes and reach? No. Did he call over for someone closer to get whatever it was he was reaching for? No. He used the handle end of broom!!! This was one of those little brooms used with a dustbin, and the bristle end was hovering just two feet from open orders. Blech!

I haven't had a problem with their food, I love their ribs, but the bartender service can be awful.  Went there last night, one bartender was working her butt off, the other one mainly watched the bruins all night.  It doesn't seem like any of the staff or manager care that their bartenders ignore the customers.  One other time a bartender spent the entire night talking to her friends and never served any drinks, I had to get the manager.  It took 45 minutes to get our meal last night.  I would hate to have my staff ignore my customers like that, but it seems this location could care less.  Oh well.

It's always odd travelling and wanting to find places to eat. This was a rare occasion where I actually sat and ate alone...I had a hockey game and a baseball game to watch in the bar area, but still.... and I was in an unfamiliar place and feeling a little separation anxiety... just a little. So.... working off of the per diem that I'll be getting reimbursed from my company for travel, I decided to swing by the old-friendly place of Chilli's.... we used to sorta frequent the one near us in Menlo Park, but I really don't know if I've been to one in the past year..... chicken fried steak....   This one was a little on the smaller size, but it was overshadowed by the fact that it ... CAME REALLY DAMN FAST!!! No.. I didn't go to chillis for a "good meal," and I didn't get it... but it was average, and that's what I was expecting, and it came quick.

I've been to a lot of great Chili's location, but this is not one of them. We've been here about five times, and the majority of our experiences here have been absolutely awful. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

I love chilis. This one is very close to my house and i go here as much as i can. This one is very small and dark, but who cares. It's crowded, and a lot of people sit at the bar and watch the game. I also looove chicken crispers!
Food is okay given that this is a chain restaurant. Service at this particular location is not great.
